page.title: 14FARMING
page.content: Sheep and cattle graze the comparatively small area of farm land available,just as they did when the monks first farmed the area hundreds of years ago.The only noticeable change is that one of the two main farms,that on the Gwent side of the river,now grows potatoes,various vegetables and soft fruits for the 'pick-your-own' trade which has become very popular in the 1980's.The other main farm,along the highest point of the Gloucestershire area,Which is predominantly a sheep farm,has now developed a large caravan park. On a south facing bank on the northern edge of the area a vineyard is being developed utilising the reasonably equable climate provided by the warming influence of the Gulf Stream.
